Package edu.wit.scds.comp2000.queue.app

Class TrainRoute

java.lang.Object
edu.wit.scds.comp2000.queue.app.TrainRoute
public final class TrainRoute
extends java.lang.Object
Representation of a train route consisting of a pair of parallel tracks, Station(s) at fixed locations along the tracks, and Train(s) that move along the tracks. Each Station serves both tracks. No two Stations are at the same location. Two trains may be passing each other at the same location however only one per track.

WARNING: Some CIRCULAR route functionality is not yet implemented!

NOTE: If you modify this class, you must retain all authorship comments. You should add/update your authorship and modification history tags after the existing tags.

Version:
0.1.0 base version, 1.0.0 initial implementation, 1.1.0 2019-10-30 replace iteration with indexing of stations and trains in getXxx( int )., 2.0.0 2021-10-30
  • restructure to use simulation callback instead of parameter passing
  • major restructuring
  • clean up
, 2.1.0 2021-11-01 finish implementation
Author:
David M Rosenberg, Your Name

    • whichDirection

      public static Direction whichDirection​(int fromStationId, int toStationId)
      Determines the direction an entity needs to travel to move from the 'from' station to the 'to' station. It takes into account the route style.
      Parameters:
      fromStationId - starting point station id #
      toStationId - ending point station id #
      Returns:
      the Direction in which an entity must travel

    • whichDirection

      public static Direction whichDirection​(Station fromStation, Station toStation)
      Determines the direction an entity needs to travel to move from the 'from' station to the 'to' station. It takes into account the route style.
      Parameters:
      fromStation - starting point station instance
      toStation - ending point station instance
      Returns:
      the Direction in which an entity must travel

    • whichDirection

      public static Direction whichDirection​(Location fromLocation, Location toLocation)
      Determines the Direction an entity must move to travel between from and to

      WARNING: As implemented, this method only works correctly for LINEAR routes!

      Parameters:
      fromLocation - the Location at the start of travel
      toLocation - the Location at the destination
      Returns:
      the Direction in which an entity must travel

    • setSimulationCallback

      static void setSimulationCallback​(TrainSimulation currentSimulation)
      Enable callback to the simulation to access:
      • configuration
      • current time
      • random number generator instance
      • logger
      • train route

      This setup is done once at the start of the simulation for this entire class

      Parameters:
      currentSimulation - instance providing callback functionality

    • main

      public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args) throws java.io.FileNotFoundException, java.io.IOException
      Test driver
      Parameters:
      args - -unused-
      Throws:
      java.io.FileNotFoundException - if the configuration file doesn't exist or can't be opened for read access
      java.io.IOException - if the logs folder doesn't exist and can't be created
